page.title: 12SANDON HALL FARM SANDON
page.content: There has been a farm on the land since the 13th century. The present farm has 410 acres. They have 333 sheep and 582 lambs. The sheep are sheared in December and May. The farmer thinks the sheep enjoy it and the sheep are dipped three times a year. They have two sheepdogs to help. As well as sheep, the farmer grows wheat, barley, oats and rape. The farm buildings are used for storing corn and housing animals. They have four tractors, one combine harvester and the other ploughs. They also have chickens, ducks for their own use, horses and a cat to chase away the mice. To scare the birds, they use a shotgun and a flare that sounds like a gun and they have a scarecrow.
